title: Nothing new in worlds for NA
body:
As always, C9 is NA's only hope.

Dlift shits the bed.

Would say something for 100 thieves but no one expected anything from them anyways.

replies.body:
Because the OP refuses to keep things civil and constructive despite being warned I'm locking this thread. Note that we mods are only Human and as such can't monitor every single thread at once. In the future if you can't respond to someone without resorting to things like insults and name-calling then don't respond at all.

Feel free to contact us at the [Moderation Discord](https://discordapp.com/channels/230113905668653056/306220435262144512) or at [Discuss the Boards]( https://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/community-moderation) for any questions, comments or concerns about this. Thank you and have a good day.

True
True
And yeah... pretty much nailed it.

At least Fnatic is doing well. I really like that team. By far my favorite EU team. Caps is a monster.

Not sure why teams keep going after Doublelift. He is an instaloss during international play.

> [{quoted}](name=IncrediPhiLL,realm=NA,application-id=9hBQwnEU,discussion-id=KgvO7UYU,comment-id=0001,timestamp=2018-10-17T11:30:49.938+0000)

I was referring to the fact that he is is never successful in intonational play. Wether he went 3-3 or 0-6, he is still in the same place... going home. 

Your personal insult offends me. Apologize to me and delete your account pls.

Tbh, I don't fell like NA team care about internationnal play at all. I feel like the player from non participating team doesn't even look the match  (minus some recent eu import).
The lack of support from your own region peers is meh
Yeah it used to be svenskeren but sense c9 actually let him grow as a player and let him do his own thing instead of just telling him to camp w.e star mid you have he seems to preform better
lamentable that c9 and vitality couldn't both make it out of groups.
I loved vitality and all their cheeky shit
Admittedly, C9 is really kicking butt this year. They have a good shot getting to the semifinals and dare I say it, a reasonable chance at the finals.

I honestly really don't like the fact that 100T got to World without fighting for it because of the championship points (who should be removed IMO, your spring performance should not have that big of an impact going to World, since the meta changes so much). We all knew this team would not be good enough for World (would have much prefered Echo Fox over them). 

Of course was also expecting the 1st seed to underperform as always (especially with Dlift in it, never liked the player because for all his Dtalk (even if most is joking), he never perform on international stage). As usual, C9 is the saving grace of NA, as the 3rd seed again no less.
Honestly tsm would have made a less pathetic showing than 100t imo. But c9 has always been na best at worlds

Quit being a whiny little puke.   Liquid went 3-3.  That's about what we expected.    They got a bit unlucky in that Edward got a fluke win over KT.  Otherwise they would have been in a tie breaker.  Once Edward got put in their group it was an uphill battle.   Put Liquid in A or D or c9s slot and they get out.  A and D were EZ groups.  And well the Korean team in B folded like a cheap suit.
I agree. TL fought well in a death group. Getting out with KT and EDG isn't so easy, and 3-3 is close enough to success.
it really is the luck of the draw, TL probably dealt with two of the top favorites for world's. I like KT better than Afreeca or China's RNG.

DLift still needs a better team. DLift is easily still one of the best Western ADCs, he just needs a good team to support his ass.

100T is a joke though, seriously. I said that days ago and they’re proving me right.

> [{quoted}](name=Spank the Fox,realm=OCE,application-id=9hBQwnEU,discussion-id=KgvO7UYU,comment-id=0002,timestamp=2018-10-17T11:53:23.832+0000)
>
> DLift still needs a better team. DLift is easily still one of the best Western ADCs, he just needs a good team to support his ass.
> 
> 100T is a joke though, seriously. I said that days ago and they’re proving me right.

No, DLift is a terrible ADC. He requires his entire team to draft around him and play around him. It's very easy for good teams to gameplan and draft around this. He doesn't play utility ADCs well. He doesn't play well when the game is supposed to be played through top or mid. He demands all the resources for his team and does nothing with them. NA doesn't have a worlds problem, they have a Doublelift is a trash ADC problem.

I agree and disagree. He is the Peyton Manning of LCS in the regular season/NA he does fantastic at World's he gets brutalized most games. He gets too nervous, I saw one of the games he won at worlds and his hands were shaking so bad.

> [{quoted}](name=CodyIicious,realm=NA,application-id=9hBQwnEU,discussion-id=KgvO7UYU,comment-id=000200000000,timestamp=2018-10-17T20:30:10.863+0000)
>
> I agree and disagree. He is the Peyton Manning of LCS in the regular season/NA he does fantastic at World's he gets brutalized most games. He gets too nervous, I saw one of the games he won at worlds and his hands were shaking so bad.

Not really Peyton. More like a diva WR maybe Dez Bryant or something.
Works for Uzi and he’s regarded the best ADC at the moment.

Agreed on this.  Pobelter seems like a great guy, but he's an "average" midlaner (average for Pros, yeah he's way better than any given rando, but significantly worse than many pro midlaners).  I think he holds up ok and can do his part in team fights, but he goes behind in lane phase on the regular and if the team can't carry him to an advantage then he's pretty ineffective.  I'm wondering if Olleh can make the next step.  I think he's got skills, but nerves are obviously a problem (see: MSI).  The other 3 are not the absolute "best" at their positions, but I think they can hang with Worlds talent. (altho not sure what effect age will have by next year)

The current TL roster can dominate NA because the 3 can cover up the weaknesses of the 1.5 (Olleh doesn't have the 'nerves' issue in NA, but runs hot/cold based on other factors) and none of the other teams are strong enough to completely exploit the gaps. (ie. go even or better against their top 3, while dominating the weaker 2)  But the better worlds teams CAN do so.  Bluntly put, the BEST international teams (especially the Korean Worlds winners) usually have solid performers at all 5 positions.  Whether due to skill or nerves, NA doesn't usually field a team that can match that criteria, and in many cases they get boned when the weak link gets dominated.  The exception that immediately comes to mind is last year's TSM who either didn't have the confidence or were simply overly protective of their weaknesses and eventually lost when teams were able to force (and win) a team fight on their terms.  Last year's TSM could've gotten out of groups if they'd USED their massive gold advantage appropriately instead of sitting on it for long stretches until the enemy felt comfortable to just say "nothing to lose, let's go!"
and to be honest its the mindset as well, eastern cultures are more holistic while western cultures are more individualistic, everyone wants to be the star.

> [{quoted}](name=Spank the Fox,realm=OCE,application-id=9hBQwnEU,discussion-id=KgvO7UYU,comment-id=0002,timestamp=2018-10-17T11:53:23.832+0000)
>
> DLift still needs a better team. DLift is easily still one of the best Western ADCs, he just needs a good team to support his ass.
> 
> 100T is a joke though, seriously. I said that days ago and they’re proving me right.

No, what doublelift needs is to NOT demand every resource in the game just to not know what he needs to do.

He has impact, who gets abandoned EVERY game and still either goes even/wins lane regardless if he gets camped because he's that good.

Xmithie is here or there. 

Pobelter is a coin flip but generally does pretty well in lane.

Olleh's playstyle is litterally restricted because of how dlift wants to play and has to babysit dlift 24/7.


Previous team he had Bjerg/Hauntzer/biofrost(biofrost who litterally bowed to dlifts playstyle no problem and played great)

He's had stacked teams, face he Dlift IS THE PROBLEM.
But what would happen if Dlift joined C9? {{sticker:sg-lux-2}}
https://media.tenor.com/images/a10578ea657628b002409314359e968c/tenor.gif

> [{quoted}](name=ShadowSlayerZ7,realm=NA,application-id=9hBQwnEU,discussion-id=KgvO7UYU,comment-id=0007,timestamp=2018-10-17T17:36:10.295+0000)
>
> But what would happen if Dlift joined C9? {{sticker:sg-lux-2}}

Then It'll be the same situation for Dlift.


The problem is that whatever team Dlift is on, he DEMANDS because he NEEDS every resource to become a functional player.


What makes c9 work is that the jungler can decide whether or not to progress their mid or top because sneaky is litterally a support style playing ADC( cept when you give him Trist/Draven, then he flips to some super carry by extreme magics) hence why he does great on things like sivir, cait(for traps and such), Ashe(when she was meta)... etc etc.

1. 8k gold lead by 15 mins is a huge gold lead, so ya it is a huge lead.

2. Stop acting like anyone I'm the planet expected anything from 100t that's a desperate attempt to try to win the argument. 

3. Doesn't have to be all considering said wadid still played at a high level and was the main reason uzi stayed getting caught the entire early game in game 5, so please educate yourself as you seem to be thoroughly lacking.

4. I stated facts and your only comeback was "you're salty".
If performance speaks louder than words then you only helped my argument more.


Do you have any idea what you're saying?... Na you don't.  Just another mindless drone.
Because C9 got EU players.

Whose the carry of the team? the NA toplaner.

I only browse forums during worlds. 
Miracle lol. Why so salty? NA is not even close the skill level of EU, don't need to be so mad about it. Just get more EU imports, you'll be fine. Look at C9. They made it out of groups. {{sticker:slayer-pantheon-thumbs}}

Last time I checked, the NA team c9 shit stomped EU team vitality, then the EU Midlaner made them lose the game for 1st seed, so your statement doesn't add up, what's even more funny is your inability to disprove any facts I've stated. 

"He stated facts he must be salty "

Nice Korean import on g2 btw{{sticker:slayer-jinx-wink}}

> [{quoted}](name=simply bad,realm=NA,application-id=9hBQwnEU,discussion-id=KgvO7UYU,comment-id=000e00000000000000000000,timestamp=2018-10-20T13:59:40.121+0000)
>
> Last time I checked, the NA team c9 shit stomped EU team vitality, then the EU Midlaner made them lose the game for 1st seed, so your statement doesn't add up, what's even more funny is your inability to disprove any facts I've stated.

1. Last time I checked those were close games. And after all they got EU imports for a reason. They carry more often than drag.

2. If you want to talk about shitstomping look at FNC vs 100T. C9 managed to get max 8k gold lead vs VIT and both those games were long as fuck. Meanwhile FNC "shitstomped" 100T and had 13k (team score 14:4) and 17k (team score 16:1) gold leads in both games. So educate yourself before talking about "shitstomping" so you don't look as salty and as dumb as you do now. 
Also let's just ignore the fact G2 beat RNG in BO5 and FNC is actually looking like the strongest team atm so your region doesn't look such a failure in comparison.

3. KR support import? Is that all you got? Last time I checked KR isn't the highest bar anymore and your NA teams are basically made out them. 100T = 2 KR and 1 CN. :D TL = 2 KR players.  What an ignorant and stupid argument. Do you think before you say something? Meanwhile C9 is the most successful team and they dont even have any KR players. They need EU imports with carry roles like jungle, mid to win. So your argument about some KR support is completely comic because he is just the guy doing his job and not the one making the big shots and plays like Perkz and Wunder. EU > KR and NA isn't even close. Get more EU imports and deal with it, kid. 

4. Disprove "facts" of some salty troll? I did that every single time, you just can't accept the facts. Also performances speak louder than words. So suck it. 
{{sticker:slayer-pantheon-thumbs}}
well my point is more often than not Peyton was great in the regular season but more often than not, stunk pretty bad in the playoffs
I want to root so hard for NA as an NA player, but im completely swept up in the FNC hype train right now. Theyre looking so good, so hopeful.

No one should be shocked. NA is just filled with solo queue heroes and internet trolls for attention & views. No one cares much for anyone else and it shows when they cant work like a team and play as one cohesive unit
Friendly reminder to keep things civil and constructive and to avoid insulting others. If it continues then this thread will be locked.

NA has no hope. The mindset of NA is to follow whatever the overlords in korea do. If you teach your child how to play chess, and he never looks to get better elsewhere or come up with his own strategies, he will never beat you because you know exactly what he is going to do...because you taught him how to play lol.
Nobody cares about NA
NA is garbage.
